author: {'steamid': '76561198185966403', 'num_games_owned': 522, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 803, 'last_played': 1701223165}
review:
This is soooooo much better than other big names in farming sim this year!!

To begin with, it is truly relaxing and the mechanics are perfect.
I have tried other popular names like Coral Island and in most of these games I couldn't really relax because I'd never find ways to make proper amount of money and the controls of farming, like selecting the right square to water would be very tedious. I couldn't get past my frustration with those games.

With this game, I never even got frustrated. The fact that there is a separate farming mode in Ooblets makes it so much easier to control. There's a variety of tasks you can do if you want to make money in some other way as well! The game is humorous in ways you wouldn't expect and the ooblets are the cutest. I also really enjoy where the updates are heading, such as the addition of Ooblet Vehicles. It's sooo fun to see a random ooblet drifting somewhere you don't expect sometimes.

This game allows me to have fun without having to be a hardcore player.
Other games with the "relaxing" tag need to learn something from Ooblets. If I wanted to grind, I'd play Dark Souls.


On an ending note, the music is bomb.

review:
Collect all the ooblets!

Pro: I didn't feel like I needed a wiki to look up recipes and how to unlock stuff

Con: I wanted it to be a low-stress game, but I got too focused on getting every new ooblets every day, especially rare ones

Really enjoyed everything about this game until the level where you have to beat arcade games. I played ~50 hours on Switch, but pretty much gave up on that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043661162', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1600, 'last_played': 1702512595}
review:
I.Love.This.Game.
AND IT STILL GETS UPDATES.
I bought it originally on Epic Games and i have over 170h in that alone already. Its funny, its silly, its so much fun to chill with. Its not time bound or stressy. You can just do your thing. Your own house, your own farm, your own shop, decorate, customize, little outfits for your creatures, collecting... It has it all. I adore it and i am happy i got it and play it even still on Steam as well. To be fair, i never thought i'd like it as much as i did. Recommend.

review:
Ooblets ist ein sehr entspanntes Spiel bei dem die Stunden nur so dahin schmelzen.
Es gibt immer etwas zu tun wie Ressourcen sammeln, Produkte herstellen und mit Personen sprechen. Die Tanz-Duelle mit den Ooblets sind ein witziger Ansatz für ein gewaltloses Kräftemessen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040595491', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1705274638}
review:
So far, it's my favorite game out of all cozy farming games. Especially quality of life features like saving whenever you want to or precise controls when working on your farm really sold this game for me.

Its systems are a bit more approachable compared to titles like Stardew Valley in a way that it makes mistakes much more forgiving. Still, that doesn't mean there isn't enough complexity and variety. There's always something to do that will keep me engaged. 

At first, I felt like the dance battles lacked in difficulty and I quickly became bored with them. However, the more you progress, they can become somewhat challenging. The different kinds of Ooblets with their variety in attacks really help to keep the battles fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561199198755266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8562, 'last_played': 1706856630}
review:
This game is stellar is you love animal crossing, stardew valley, harvest moon, pokemon etc.
 It's the perfect amount of grind with a fun card game system involving silly humor and dance parties. It's got replayability out the wazoo and it's a super cute and fun experience.
The only "problems" I'd say that I'd have with it is that it doesn't (hopefully yet) have modding capabilities. I've noticed a few bugs but It's mostly simple things that won't totally kill your game. Such as heads randomly shrinking on characters and if your wearing rollerskates you tend to get thrown behind furniture in your home.
In the end though easily at LEAST 9/10 do recommend! :D

review: I was skeptical during early access since I was so deep into ACNH at the time that I didn't really want to give this game a try. Steam sale this week and I figured I'd give it a shot... it's AMAZING. Great twist on cozy/farming games. I feel like after the popularity of ACNH we were flooded with "cozy" games that just never were as good because they never did anything different. This game does it. Worth it with a discount or full price imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101886701', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2327, 'last_played': 1701426017}
review: 游戏的养成部分很棒，会让人停不下来去完成各式各样的搜集。但是在通关以及财务自由之后（大概三十五小时）会显得比较无聊，无法再从中获取更多的激励感和成就感，导致关闭游戏之后就再也不想打开，而下次要打开也大概率是因为游戏的季节性活动。个人觉得是缺少像动森那样的沙盒类玩法，即更多的建造经营。另一方面在卡牌战斗的玩法深度上也偏简单，缺少深度，也是导致后期内容贫乏的一大原因。游戏非常有潜力，我个人超级喜欢！希望制作组能更新出更多的玩法内容。

author: {'steamid': '76561199558873018', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1701533408}
review: 今天更新，简体中文有乱码？欧布精灵查看动作那里bug

author: {'steamid': '76561198814585770', 'num_games_owned': 238, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1701527539}
review: 宝可梦收集+养成，前期新鲜感挺足的，但到了中后期需要收集的东西越来越多，尤其是木板条，地里长出来的完全不够用。系统设计方面还有提升空间，比如教程指引有些简略，加上邮箱里的邮件读了之后就没法再看了，导致我一开始饶了很多弯路。跳舞系统很有新意，但是新鲜感过了之后就会感觉动画有些长。总体来说还是很有趣的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198316327979', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1378, 'last_played': 1700881180}
review:
通关了，但又没完全通关，只是达成大结局，还有很多欧布精灵没有收集，感觉还是挺肝的，每天就是重复去别人家里[strike] 偷 [/strike]拿东西，欧布大陆的人还真是对外人不设防啊，每天都能在别人家里拿点吃的和钱（
1.感觉游戏的成就系统还是少了点，譬如每个人的【贴纸全收集】这种居然没有
2.星星的获得途径也好少，本人最爱成就送的200星（相当于白嫖，特别不喜欢每天做日常和舞蹈谷仓获得的星[spoiler]我是大懒猪没错 [/spoiler]
3.说实话舞蹈系统刚开始挺喜欢的，后面收集其他欧布精灵完全就觉得是重复无意义劳动（不是说设计的不好的意思哈）就是说能不能开一个【欧布精灵到达10级以后可以托管跳舞】呢？
4.制作组是不是在考验我的记忆力……每天的愿望机器人我真的跟人打完一圈招呼后会忘记某个人今天需要什么[spoiler] 我是鱼的记忆没错 [/spoiler]能不能信箱开一个阅读往期邮件的功能呢？还是说有这个功能我自己没找到……？
画风很q很可爱，即使是原价入的我觉得也挺值得，升华一下主旨那就是……
保护环境人人有责√
打倒黑心老板√

author: {'steamid': '76561198318385571', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 5402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4382, 'last_played': 1701512739}
review:
真的真的超级超级喜欢这个游戏~
画风好可爱而且各种元素我也很喜欢早早就想来测评了~但是想玩完整个过程以后再整体看看...........
嗯.............
然后我就卡关了~~~~~~~~~~~
为什么这么休闲的游戏....................还有小游戏最高分才能解锁新剧情...............
有没有考虑手残玩家，喜欢种地休闲玩家~~~~有没有一种可能性就是~~~想要轻松地游玩呢？？？
小游戏记录七百分，我玩了十几次一百分都到不了.....
真的很难受....
我是很想继续解锁新的剧情和小可爱们...........
可是我觉得这几个小游戏能拿到最高分这个期间我是完全没有游戏乐趣的了...........
可能大家都是高玩，我是手残,,,,,,,,,,
港前小镇我的痛苦,,,,
真的很难受了，搞个三四百分我觉得我还能接受，让我达到七百多,,,,,,,,,,,
真的好像哭了，已经自闭了.....
为什么会这么难

——————————————
上面是我本来的感受QAQ
但是好像对话了一个NPC可以花钱上榜！！！！！！！
啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊啊我怎么才看见....
我就知道制作组没有那么坏，呜呜呜呜呜
更爱这游戏了怎么办！！！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198980307130', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1701148121}
review: I initially bought Ooblets when it first released on Epic Games back in 2020 and have loved the game from the very start. Getting to see how much it's grown since then has been amazing with the addition of new regions to visit, events to enjoy, and items to collect. It's always nice to see a game continue to receive such love in it's updates. Ooblets is a fairly simple game with an adorably quirky style that does a great job at combining the farming sim and creature collecting genres. Some may say it lacks depth but I really don't think it needs any extra depth, as it's meant to be a silly little game where you collect silly little creatures and make them have silly little dance battles with catchy music. That might not be everyone's cup of tea but to me it's perfect. I'm so excited to see it on Steam now because in my opinion it deserves as much attention and love as it can get! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198246908268', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1701021566}

author: {'steamid': '76561199033845554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3951, 'last_played': 1702890026}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983673342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1428, 'last_played': 1705022244}
review:
If you're looking for a game to relax with, you can't do better than Ooblets. Played best with a meditative attitude, Ooblets is a gentle farming sim with quicky characters and a really fun vibe. 
If you're looking for a super in-depth game with lots of deep characters and relationship building, this isn't the game for you - but if you're looking for something light to relax with after a hard day, I can't recommend Ooblets highly enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112684481', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1294, 'last_played': 1706842406}
review:
"As someone that is still new to the gaming world, Ooblets was a great starter game for me. I started playing it during the Halloween event and loved all the decorations and spooky adventures I got to take my character on. I spend most of my time tending to my garden taking me back to my FarmVille days. Would highly recommend to the aesthetic girlies and pre-teens!" - BeautifulBoaz

As someone who falls into neither of the above categories, this game is fantastically whimsical and looks great. Runs like a champ on the SteamDeck, even on lower wattages. Would recommend to anyone who likes how the game looks, because it won't disappoint you with the gameplay underneath the pretty exterior.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995351187', 'num_games_owned': 832, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1707096852}
review:
This game is so goofy and fun.  The characters are so much fun, the sound design is incredible, and each little ooblet is adorable.  There's a lot to do in this game, and so many cute little critters to befriend.

Unlike pokemon, you actually respect the ooblets, and instead of combat you have dance battles because ooblets love dancing.  I have so much fun with this, and it works great on the steam deck as well (which is super cozy).

review:
Ooblets is a wonderful little experience where you get to collect cute friends. One of the best parts is they get to follow you around. 

It has a task system that makes sure you always have a goal to reach which makes it so the farming and gathering aspect doesn't get old. The goals are also actually attainable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267491199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1704957853}
review:
I already knew this game would grant me at least 10 - 20 hours of fun, but it really has become my cozy game of the year. The time management aspect becomes only as hectic as you allow it to be, making for a fast paced farming/townie sim or a relaxed "one thing at a time" animal crossing-esque game. There are loads of different categories of things to be collected (for progression and just for fun) and the challenges asked of you are never too daunting. 

I feel no rush to get to the end of this game ASAP and know I will be coming back to it to see different holidays and seasonal events for at least another year or two. It is extremely accessible for all levels of gamers, works great with controller, m+k and steam deck and watching a silly little ooblet dance never fails to brighten my day :) Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061431211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1697938522}
review:
Having played various farming RPGs, Ooblets is underwhelming.
Plant Crops...
Gather Things...
Hit Rocks...
Collect Pets...
Gain Money from those things to decorate your house...

The humour was great at the start, but it starts to get stale the more you play this game.

Music is tolerable. But eventually, I've gotten sick of listening to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057883515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1700764893}
review: I normally have a terrible time playing games that have a 'real time' management system where the in game passes based on the real world clock. It leaves me feeling stressed, which is counter to what the game usually wants to achieve. Ooblets has this time system, but the different tasks and milestones feel like things to look forward to rather than deadlines I have to meet! If you are like me and don't particularly like a clock counting down your in game day then I am happy to report this one is not at all overbearing or egregious like other examples.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066707868', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1700655883}
review: This game is so much fun and I am so happy its finally on Steam!! I have been playing it on the Nintendo Switch for a while, but much prefer my Steam games, so I was over the moon when I heard it was coming to Steam and I just love playing it! The music is so fun, and has my SO playing along at times on his bass. The characters are so cute, and the gameplay is pretty easy as well. Its has a kind of Stardew Valley/Pokemon vibe and I am so here for it. Def recommend this game! Shout-Out to my bestie who introduced me to this addicting game LOL.

review: This is one of the cutest games I've ever played. There's so much to do: upgrades, dance battles, cooking, monster cataloguing, socializing with the townspeople, unearthing a vast and mysterious conspiracy, etc. etc. etc. This game incorporates elements of Stardew, Animal Crossing, and Pokemon, but it has a unique flavor all its own. You can really see the heart that went into every little detail of this wonderfully silly world.

review: Ooblets is a wonderful game and the Steam port is a good one.  Do not listen to all the negative air around the Steam vs Epic stuff with this game, it is not worth your time.  This is a lovely family-friendly game which may or may not burn your hours away as you relax and simply play Ooblets.  10/10 would recommend if you're looking for something a little silly and very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965603125', 'num_games_owned': 1360, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1434, 'last_played': 1700592839}
review:
It's hard to believe that I haven't reviewed Ooblets already, considering how much I enjoyed it! The visual style is great, and if you enjoy the traditional farming sim gameplay loop, but want a little bit more of a gotta-catch-em-all vibe, then Ooblets is a great game to check out.

When I was reviewing my nominations for the Steam Awards I found that Ooblets was my top pick of the year in three different categories. Maybe if you don't like cute things and enjoy colors then Ooblets isn't the game for you. Otherwise, it may very well be!

review: I love this game, it is very relaxing and fun to play. The soundtrack and sound effects are really entertaining and the characters and dialogue are really silly. There's dance battles as a deck builder creature catcher, as well as mini games, unlocking new areas, farming, and running your own store. Ooblets feels very finished for a game that came out not even 2 months ago but it still feels like there is plenty of room for expanding. The whole thing feels very adventure time esque.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368992467', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 361, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1700531100}
review: I don't know but to me this just screamed generic farming game with little guys that follow you. I was put way off by the lackluster character customization that first happens in the game where you can't pick a gender at all, barely any color at all and only a few hairstyles. The voices oh god the voices when you talk to other characters are just quite annoying. I know what they were trying to do by trying to get that classic Banjo and Kazooie speech or Animal Crossing speech but the voices in those games are nice and calm... the voices in this game for the characters are almost equal to doing clicks with your tongue. Didn't like the game which is quite sad since it looks promising...

author: {'steamid': '76561198361522478', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1703251766}
review:
我的筆電竟然玩得了這款3D遊戲！

可愛～偏線性、肝起來算是比較舒服的寵物養成＋農場模擬＋生活模擬遊戲，比較適合沒任務就不知道要做什麼的玩家。

各種遊戲機制都滿有趣且特別~跳舞battle做成卡牌遊戲，我也滿喜歡的，雖然卡牌的部分感覺沒什麼深度，不知道對手要出什麼牌，感覺很多時候都是隨機亂出。

與NPC的互動感比較薄弱，同個對話會出現在不同NPC身上，除了對話、解任務、買賣好像就沒有什麼互動了，這點比較可惜。

不知道是不是因為還在遊戲前期，一天下來沒什麼事情可以做，錢也比較難賺，重複性比較高，隨著升級遊戲內容會越來越豐富，還是很期待之後開店的。

整體來說，這遊戲除了帶給我不少新鮮感，也真的滿有樂趣的，畫風也很可愛，可以推薦！

author: {'steamid': '76561198078458566', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1701022810}
review: I was in high school when the ooblets kick starter started. Instant hyped back then. After a few years I asked "what happened to ooblets?" so I went and googled it. Saw it was on Epic and bought it there. After the own your own shop update I put down ooblets for a while. Saw it finally release on steam and bought it again. There are only a few games I have bought on every console I own. But this is the first game I bought on 2 different launchers. I love the music. Amazing. Love the coziness. If I had to add a single gripe by force it would be the lack of difficult options. I like that the dance battles are easy, it adds to the cozy. But when I've built my team well it's embarrassing seeing the opposite ooblets at 0 points and I'm at 40 in a handful of turns. If you like farming sims, creature collecting, decorating, and like to 100% games this game is perfect and sprinkles a little perfect music and vibes to sew it all together. If your someone who is looking only into creature battles then I'd recommend watching some game play first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201980482', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1670, 'last_played': 1702478679}
review:
宝可梦+卡牌+种田，优点就不多赘述，缺点也很明显。前期非常缺钱，缺到每天只有十几块，而新地区的蔬菜种子基本要五六十卖一个。后期交易站提升之后建议直接卖辣角面包，30个辣角面包近8000元，卖个两次基本上就又不会缺钱了。再有就是闪光宝可梦出现频率太少，基本上15天才能随机遇到一个，全图鉴就要硬等。其次抓宝可梦基本要用蔬菜，蔬菜种下去要等4，5天才成熟，万一遇到闪光宝可梦但没蔬菜，不好意思再硬等吧。家具互动也比较少，基本上只能睡觉，坐，存东西和煮饭。除去冰箱，床，沙发，炉灶，其他家具都只能看。还有就是汉化问题，部分翻译缺失，而部分词语汉化组没能翻译出精髓，比如咖啡，游戏里英语叫Beanjuice， 汉化成了春豆饮，个人认为不如直接翻译成豆汁，那才叫一个地道。

卡牌对战部分做的十分不错，许多人说不能组牌是个缺陷，我看来则相反，因为单独组牌有些组合过于强势了，每个宝可梦都有自己的长处和短处，合理搭配阵容才能相互补缺，这才是亮点。我个人推荐鼓舞流，主力：努波叶+树墩块，其余的可以位置可以带：舒蘑，好斗小爪，独眼机这种低费爆发宝可梦，或是长腿鱼这种按手牌数一段一段加分的宝可梦。但这种也怕恐惧流以及眩晕流，遇到后期的小boss矿工用仙人掌1v1单挑时能被一直眩晕控住，也需要灵活应变。

author: {'steamid': '76561198312498520', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1709565786}
review:
画面：♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥
太可爱了吧，我真的很吃这种卡通风格的。
而且闲下来时看看小镇里的人们和欧布们在尬舞也很有趣。
-----------------------
音乐：♥ ♥ ♥ ♥
好听~蛮有节奏的，逛街时可以看到镇长她们在伴着音乐尬舞，笑的。
比舞时的音乐也比较欢快，让我很有参与感。
-----------------------
玩法：♥ ♥ ♥ ♥ ♥
有种地，有精灵养成，有图鉴收集，有人物换装，有NPC好感，有比舞出卡套路。。。
足够让我慢慢收集一段时间了~

author: {'steamid': '76561198843829141', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 4782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1705026564}
review:
玩了10小时,画风不错,精灵也很可爱,玩法比较坐牢,卡资源卡得厉害.
不是我又出钱又出力整个小镇建设都靠我,任务完成了给点钱也行啊?纯是爱的奉献吗?我是来游戏里996吗?小镇和农场不大,资源刷新极慢.卡牌战斗前几次很新颖,等到舞厅开了要天天记得去刷资源感觉就想吐,升5级后一连接了好几个俱乐部修复的任务真的感觉有被push到,追在我后面要材料的感觉.木板也缺,那个线花卖的特别贵,还总是要,每天出门兜里也就20-100左右的存款,家具和服装得到什么时候能自由购入?那个钓鱼系统跟没有一样,攒一堆罐子10个资源才能钓一次,捞上来点不值钱的小垃圾,不需要任何操作.

喜欢线性流程有任务指引的可以入,平常更偏好自由沙盒的再观望观望吧.比cozy groove还坐牢(冲着衣服和家具好看的份上忍了玩了100+h).不如澳洲梦想镇,喜欢捕捉精灵的不如去玩磁带妖怪.

review: A fun game with lots to do.  IF you like gathering things, catching things and turn based "combat", you'll love this game.  The characters are fun and wacky, and the overall vibe is charming.  2 minor notes: time is wonky, I always either have too much or not enough energy per day;  and there are not enough late game achievements.  By the end of the story,  I had all of my badges, and it felt kind of draggy,  If you don't mind that, this is a fantastic way to spend your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020048080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3968, 'last_played': 1700759356}
review:
I was expecting to like this game, but not as much as I did. It came at just the right time, I've been going through a rough time and I just needed something cute and simple to take my mind off things. Ooblets scratched that itch.

The game is a cute mix of farming, creature collecting, daily quests, friendship building, and dance battles.

Farming can end up being fully automated so long as you provide seeds once you have enough ooblets and ooblet houses, so you can move on and explore.

I enjoyed all the different islands you go to. They change it up too so it's not always just dance battles you need to do to accomplish thing (though I think I liked the dance battles the most).

Eventually you can even open your own shop and sell your items to the townsfolk. I never really ran out of things to do as the game progressed, if anything I always wished I had more energy and time in the day so I could do more. Which isn't a bad thing at all.

I'm glad I started playing during the Hallowe'en event. There were lots of cool spooky items to get for my house and with all the leftover candy I was able to recycle to make lots of bait for fishing which helped a lot with supplies I needed towards the end of the game.

Oh and I really like their take on shinies (gleamies) in this game. If they spawn, you'll know. There's shooting starts and fireworks around the town so you can't miss them, you just need to look around a bit. So while it's still down to change that they'll spawn any given day it's not down to chance per encounter.

Anyway this game has a lot to love. I've already gotten all the achievements but haven't finished the main story yet. I'm at the very end though, and I'm glad I played this game.

There isn't much commitment needed either, you can play as much or as little as you like without feeling the pressure to get to the next save or the next big thing like in other games. It's just good casual fun for as long as you want or need.

Pick up Ooblets and have a splenda time ;)


Update: Wow after all these hours on the game I only just got the joke that is Outgrids name >_<

author: {'steamid': '76561199029766709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2701, 'last_played': 1704069478}
review:
The game is cute. I am personally a huge fan of the chonky graphic style of the game. The music is pretty good and the sound effects are nice as well. There are some parts when the music is a bit louder than the rest of the game but it's mainly in specific sections. But also, [b] the ooblets are adorable!!!!! [/b] 

The plot line of the game is very simple and not too bad, there isn't a 'finish' for the game. After you finish the main storyline you can keep farming and playing ooblets. 

When you first start the game it is a bit grindy because you have to earn in-game money to be able to afford to upgrade your farming tools and other things. But, once you get to a certain part of the game, making money in it is fairly easy. 

I am glad the devs realized that the achievement section isn't limited to just getting all of the ooblets, all the recipes, and or all the crops to harvest. 

I would recommend Ooblets if you like a bit of grind, with some awesome graphics, colors, and some good music. But the main plot is short.

review: This game is SO adorable and has a lot of unique qualities. I streamed this and other community members were loving the names and creativity that go on in this game. It's just different, but also super cute and cozy. I can't wait to progress in the game and hoping there's a Christmas event! The halloween event has been fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112952905', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2991, 'last_played': 1702871945}
review: I really enjoyed this game; it's fun, silly, cute, and overall just a vibe. I would play this game for 6 hrs at a time & not even realize how much time had passed. The achievements aren't too difficult to get either, aside from maybe a couple being a bit grindy, but I really didn't mind because I was just chilling playing the game post story line. If you're a cozy game fan or a farming sim fan, Ooblets is definitely worth looking into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278328942', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1218, 'last_played': 1705243503}
review:
首先，游戏很可爱，音乐也很可爱，是我喜欢的类型。
其次，差评是给存档的bug，云存档同步有bug，我在PC玩的没能同步到steam deck就算了，还把steam deck的旧存档上传了，最恶心的是还覆盖了我pc的进度。我辛辛苦苦肝了几天的存档全没了。
看了下评论不止我一个人有这样的问题。
这种最基础的问题都不能解决，还玩什么。。。 
心态直接爆炸

review: This was a gift from my boyfriend, and at the time I didn't know anything about it. How it's going: I play every day, and last Saturday I played for ten hours straight. Sometimes I forget to eat because of this game. The music goes so hard for no reason. I even made an Excel sheet of all the different Ooblets so I know what I need to get. I tell my real-life friends to play Ooblets. Ooblets has consumed my life. My boyfriend now kind of regrets getting it for me because it's all I want to do. Thank you so much creators of Ooblets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113821453', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3505, 'last_played': 1705720080}
review:
Platinei esse jogo no dia 07/11/2023 com um total de 58hrs na versão 1.4

OBS: Sei que esse jogo no passado teve vários problemas com a [b]Epic Games Store[/b] e a falta de respeito dos Devs, não concordo com a ação deles porém não estou aqui para julgá-los e sim para falar somente sobre o jogo.

[h1]Resumo do jogo[/h1]
O jogo mistura vários tipos de ideias em uma coisa só, eu acho que daria [b]RPG[/b] e [b]Casual[/b] como gêneros desse jogo. 
Basicamente você chega na sua cidade nova e descobre que tem que "salvar" a cidade ajudando a construir e renovar estabelecimentos assim como no [url=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animal_Crossing]Animal Crossing[/url], as formas de ganhar dinheiro e materiais é comprando sementes, plantando, cultivando, vendendo a colheita e limpando sua fazenda, ideia tirada do [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/413150/Stardew_Valley/]Stardew Valley[/url] e outra coisa tirada desse mesmo jogo é o sistema de energia e horário; Para conseguir fazer progressão no jogo você participa de um sistema de batalhas de criaturas que é muito inspirado no [url=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pokémon]Pokémon[/url] também, apesar das batalhas serem em [b]Card Game[/b], e sobre isso não se desanime com o jogo pelo fato do [b]Card Game[/b], eu não gosto desse gênero e adorei esse jogo, é um [b]Card Game[/b] bem simples e fácil nada complexo! O jogo também tem um sistema de amizade com os NPCs mas não é nada muito complexo também. O sistema de colecionismo do jogo é muito bom para quem é perfeccionista e um detalhe com isso é que mesmo depois de você pegar todas as conquistas do jogo ainda há muito o que se fazer no jogo então eu diria que para pegar um 100% real você chegue perto das 90hrs.

[h1]Controles[/h1]
Eu joguei o jogo das duas formas que ele permite, com controle e mouse + teclado, achei muito bem adaptadas e não tive problemas, você pode mudar de controle no momento que você quiser não precisa abrir nenhum menu para isso.

[h1]Progressão[/h1]
Esse jogo é daqueles que você começa vazio e sem entender coisa alguma, e do nada parece que aprendeu a "língua" do jogo, já sabe tudo que precisa fazer, o nome dos Ooblets e não consegue parar de jogar porque tem tanta coisa para fazer que você só vai indo, e quando vai ver já é 5 da manhã! E apesar do jogo não ter tanta coisa comparada com outros jogos maiores, eu acho que tem na quantidade certa, um pouco mais e um pouco menos teria deixado ele irregular na minha opinião.

[h1]Estilo gráfico e OST[/h1]
O estilo gráfico do jogo é muito "relaxante" de se olhar, muito fofo e engraçado, os personagens ficam dançando por aí, a animação deles de conversar é hilária, já dei muita risada com coisas básicas desse jogo, e os designs dos Ooblets são perfeitos, bem originais e com muito carisma. Os menus são simples de fácil entendimento não tive nenhum problema com isso. E as músicas seguem a mesma ideia do jogo, a primeira vez que você escuta você não entende nada, aí conforme você vai jogando, você vai dançando junto com as músicas, muito boas, complementam muito o jogo, perfeitas!

[h1]Localização[/h1]
A falta de localização desse jogo provavelmente é o maior ponto negativo dele, muito chato em 2023 um jogo lançar sem o idioma português, não tenho problema em jogar inglês porém é sempre bom ter jogos localizados para nós.

[h1]Considerações finais[/h1]
Se você é fã de [url=https://pt.wikipedia.org/wiki/Animal_Crossing]Animal Crossing[/url], [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/413150/Stardew_Valley/]Stardew Valley[/url] e outros jogos com essa vibe pode ir fundo que você não vai se arrepender, embora eu diria que o preço é um pouco alto pela quantidade de conteúdo, eu esperaria uma promoção!
[b]Obrigada por ler minha análise e espero de coração que consiga te ajudar sobre comprar ou não o jogo![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197994131327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1576, 'last_played': 1702266739}
review:
I will be honest. I read a lot about this game. It is highly suggested on different forums when looking for something cozy. I was expecting a great game.

But... I was really disappointed. IN THE BEGINNING.

This game at first, for the first several hours, was super confusing. I had no idea what to do. There's barely any handholding. I don't like when games treat you like an inefficient toddler but I also don't like it when they leave you alone to figure EVERYTHING out. But if I had to pick the lesser of 2 evils, I'd choose the former.

This game at first is confusing af. I had to keep googling how to do things. I didn't understand how anything worked. The game gives you less than the basics when you start.

However, now that I am 20+ hours in, everything is so much better. Don't get me wrong, I still have to look up certain recipes and how to do things but the game is SO much fun. And it IS relaxing. You can do everything at your own pace. Yes, there is a clock but nothing is constrained by time restrictions.

This game is highly addictive in the farming Sim category. You need to grow various amounts of crops in order to make money. Some of these crops need to be further broken down into ingredients to use to battle ooblets in hopes to get a seed. This seed, once planted and cared for, will grow another ooblet and further grow your little army.

I haven't played many card based battle games but once you get the flow of this, it's highly addictive and cute.

I really recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a fun farming sim that allows you to take it easy. Be patient (more than me!!), explore, and enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198808229643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1712445174}
review:
I've been a devoted fan of Ooblets since its very first release on Xbox. This game has captivated me to the point that I intend to own it on every platform available. The stunning aesthetics, delightful dialogue, and wholesome gameplay make it an all-time favorite. I couldn't be happier with the chance to decorate my house, farm, and collect these adorable critters through dance battles.

The overall experience is truly enjoyable, but there are a couple of minor setbacks. The regeneration time for certain materials, like Quibs, can be a bit frustrating. Additionally, obtaining some recipes after completing the storyline can be a tad difficult. It would be great to keep receiving recipe papers for all recipes instead of relying on the dance barn. 

Nevertheless, I highly recommend this game to any wholesome gaming enthusiast. It has helped me unwind and escape into a world filled with endless charm.It's a delightful experience that I wholeheartedly appreciate.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305730838', 'num_games_owned': 5711, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1698752363}
review:
[h1]————————————[/h1]
[h1]欧布大陆的极致休闲之旅 [/h1]

[i] 在这冰冷无情的城市里 [/i]
你厌倦了城市的灯红酒绿，尔虞我诈，踏上了驶向欧布大陆的小船。在那里，你将拥有一片属于自己的农场，结识脾气古怪但是善良的小镇居民们，更有机会收集并培养虎头虎脑的欧布小精灵。你满怀期待，开始幻想未来的生活……（总感觉所有的种田游戏都是这个剧情模板233）

[i] 你你你你要跳舞吗 [/i]
本作的基础玩法与世面上的主流种田游戏别无二致。发展基建，扩大农田，早日住上大house，美美装饰；与小镇居民们对话，增加好感度，解锁道具；完成各式各样的跑腿任务，赚取丰厚的报酬。除此之外，本作还融入了极有特色的跳舞——卡牌战斗的玩法。玩家可以给与欧布精灵心仪的物品道具，与其斗舞，通过卡牌战斗的形容决出胜利，然后获取其种子。玩家播种培养后收货就能拥有该欧布精灵，每欧布精灵都拥有专属的卡组，让玩家在以后的斗舞中拥有更多的可能性。同时每种欧布精灵都拥有三种不同的形态，喜欢集齐图鉴与收集马拉松的玩家一定会乐此不疲。总体而言，本作的游戏玩法与大部分剧情任务设计都只能算中规中矩，但得益于作者营造的轻松休闲氛围，接地气的本地化，总是让玩家沉迷其中，时间不知不觉流逝。无聊的午后，伴随着游戏悠闲放松的音乐，种种田，斗斗舞，好生惬意。

[i] 购买建议 [/i]
也许为了迎合游戏悠闲放松的调性，游戏的节奏被放的很缓，如果你是个急性子，长时间的游玩后，必然对战斗拖沓的节奏感到不满，同时拘泥于卡组较低的构筑自由度，这也是游戏被诟病最多的地方与痛点。倘若你能接受并享受这种缓慢的悠然自得与惬意感，那么这款游戏不容错过。游戏目前看会有动森一样长线更新活动版本，反复游玩性有一定保障，性价比不错。

[i]其它吐槽 [/i]

有些对话一定要走到相应位置才能触发，有点浪费时间。万圣节活动类似于单机抽卡，但是会出重复道具，不能快速收集齐道具，且很多地方的动画不能跳过，非常折磨。游戏的手柄适配不是特别好，按键设计有点奇怪，且没有震动。最后的最后，联机模式，plz。


[h1]欢迎关注或加入鉴赏家：游话好说。我们是一群游戏爱好者，希望能评测来帮助大家认识更多好游戏，期待您的同行！[/h1]
[u]https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42228259[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561199010459210', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1698716246}
review:
Ich wünschte, ich würde dieses Spiel lieben. Ich habe es gekauft, um es ausprobieren zu können und habe es dann zurück gegeben.

Die Dance-Battles sind immer gleich und keine Herausforderung. Viele Pflanzen brauchen ewig, um zu wachsen. Die Energie geht zu schnell runter. Man kann untertags nur Nickerchen machen und nicht bis zum nächsten Morgen durchschlafen (was ich aber oft gerne getan hätte). Die Taschen bzw. der Stauraum am Anfang sind sehr begrenzt und deshalb nervig. Man muss viel verkaufen, obwohl man das eigentlich gar nicht möchte.

Wenn das Spiel im Angebot ist, werde ich es mir nochmal überlegen, ob ich es haben möchte, aber 29 EUR sind mir leider definitiv zu viel für dieses Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036053006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2510, 'last_played': 1699821804}
review:
I played this game almost every evening and am now through the main quest. It is really cute and a good way to wind down. Would totally recommend to people, who like this kind of game and cutesy humor.

I have two small complaints though. While PortVoran was a fun area with a lot of mini games, was the mountain rather tedious with the quests sending you up and down the mountain. It felt almost like a stupid joke after I won the mountain climbing badge in a dance off.
And the second complaint (at the time of writing) is the lack of controler suport for the Reconstitooter. I could only access the menu with mouse and keyboard. I hope they fix that soon.

Overall is the game fun though, with quirky characters and lovely weird ooblets.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031440161', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1461, 'last_played': 1698585956}
review:
Even if you aren't vaguely aware that there is a stupid Internet fight about this title with both sides accusing each other of being entitled, out of touch, snowflake monsters, you will immediately notice that whoever made this game is extremely pleased with themselves.

It starts with the language. Just about every noun - proper or otherwise - has been been intentionally misspelled or changed to a diminutive or punny form of itself. Treats become "treabies." Fructose? "Froobtose." Watering can? "Dribbly Can." Hoe? "Dirt scraper." Coffee? "Beanjuice." I leave you to deduce what "fartichokes" are. It's like kawaii culture and Australian slang had a filthy, greasy pound session under a neon tarp in a vacant lot, and both were sober enough to know better. Your item list by the end of the game is such a confounding jumble of nerdy lunch table inside jokes that it's hard to keep pushing through.

So, you may be inclined, if you are over the age of 20 and just a slight bit jaded, to view this joyful, goofy, carefree, psychedelic mess of a thing with the same wry, dissociative disposition as you would your sugared up grade school cousin. Fun to watch, but the check better cash soon.

I think Ooblets largely delivered what it promised, if not how it promised. Publishing cat fight aside, the game is a unique mashup of the cozy farm and monster collection genre that is worth a look. The detailed animations, quirky characters, and small sprinkling of expectation subversion will occasionally inspire a half smirk.

There are warts. Lots of polygon clipping between character costumes and the environment. The item management needs to be massively streamlined. Storage is far too expensive and takes up far too much room. The day/season cycle seems to be a strange mashup of sleep-to-save/end day cycle of Stardew and the real-time-is-real-time convention of Animal Crossing. You can't pass time without sleeping or napping, but you must be low on energy to nap or after a certain time of day to sleep. Seasons appear to follow the actual season of the year. I spent the entire game in Halloween.

Pick it up on sale. Worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965213894', 'num_games_owned': 1506, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1828, 'last_played': 1698693642}
review:
This game is very cute, especially with the accessories you can equip your Ooblets with. But ultimately, getting more Ooblets comes down to engaging in dance battles, which are repetitive and not particularly strategic. I had no desire to "catch 'em all", knowing how many dance battles I'd have to endure.

Also, the last area you visit as part of the main quest is obnoxious, requiring you to go back and forth on a long mountain path, and then return to Badgetown, repeating this for each NPC on your way to the top in an increasingly-long trek. Lampshading the ridiculousness with dialogue doesn't make it any less frustrating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198863052070', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1439, 'last_played': 1699774509}
review:
缝合怪，轻量级，低难度，工作党狂喜。
说几个技巧，一，大量木材获取办法：先把还原机升到顶级，超级钓饵能木板和金属；二，精灵小屋优于机器，机器只能取暖洒水，而且水滴是稀有物品，精灵小屋真正解放双手而且升级材料很好找；三，线花很缺少，可以多除杂草，会掉三到五个线花种子；四，衣服店老板的宠物在展板的对面，很难找；五，推荐饲养好入手的精灵，木咚咚（眩晕对方一回合），鼓舞蛙（初始必得还是很不错的），逃逃菇（惊慌和消除惊慌），长腿精灵（高分）……

I love Ooblets. This game is peak coziness, it brings me comfort and joy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097060079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1698347041}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098280632', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4995, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2961, 'last_played': 1698828254}
review:
The art style of this game on my recommended list is what initially drew me in, reminding me of similar minimalist/simplified style games I enjoyed this year. When I went through the recent reviews of this new release I kept seeing comments referring to some controversy with the devs. But I wanted to just play the game unbiased and here's my honest review of what my experience has been so far!

[h3]Things I like[/h3]
- There is SO much to do, like all the time. I never feel like there's nothing I could be doing with my day in-game. 
- The Ooblets are so cute. I mean do I have to say it?? (yes, yes I do) They are adorable and there are [i]so[/i] many to catch my GOD. The gleamy versions are actually kinda rare feeling too so that's cool. (I was afraid they wouldn't be)
- Plenty of items to collect, hoarding items in games makes me happy and the game offers many a container for you to store them in. 
- The player shop is very fun to operate, there are many mini games in Ooblets which I appreciate. 

[h3]Things that need improvement[/h3]
- Some sort of icon or something in our Almanac indicating which Ooblets you've already scanned/printed statues at the Lernery would be helpful. 
- a mini-map of any kind to toggle with 'm' would be super helpful. Especially for the later areas that are much larger. 
- More clothing/player customization! There aren't a lot of cute clothing options in the game. Some of the shoes clip through pants and some hats don't fit most of the hairstyles. Eyebrows I wish would match the hair color for example and a lighter skintone for us vampires? Maybe spend gummies to unlock special skin colors like lilac, green etc.?
- Icon/something to indicate quantity of the furniture item you've clicked on to purchase. I've accidentally bought multiple of something I didn't need copies of a few times now.
- Quick use function for the consumables on your hotbar? Unless there's a secret I don't know about I have to hit tab and click to use each consumable, making my hotbar useless unless I have a hankering item/tool there.
[hr][/hr]

Overall I love this game and I'm sure some things will be worked on in time, very happy with this so far though. It is pretty grindy but I'm the type of player that enjoys grinding. Happy gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561199116607645', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2837, 'last_played': 1700207570}

2. Wood! Is there no place to pick wood in the whole town? Just my yard? Isn't that a little unreasonable? And the demand for wood in the game itself is very large, and the refresh efficiency in the yard is very low, which is really unreasonable.
3. emmm...

author: {'steamid': '76561198301770746', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1699601747}
review:
J'avais déjà joué quand il était sur epic mais j'ai préféré attendre qu'il sort de manière plus définitivement avant d'y retoucher. Ooblets est un jeu très complet, et purée la traduction française fait vraiment plaisir à voir. L'humour du jeu a été respecté lors de celle-ci.
C'est un jeu mimi de collection d'Oobs mais aussi de ferme et de battle de danse ! L'ost est entraînante lors des battles, OOblets est pour moi un jeu incroyable et complet où nous n'avons pas le temps de s'ennuyer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198855287559', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1320, 'last_played': 1698840016}
review:
一款非常适合女孩子玩的种田类卡牌游戏（个人认为）
画风很可爱，我很喜欢种田游戏，但是又不喜欢写实风格和像素风，对画风要求很高，这个游戏的画面、音乐和配色都很好。
玩法比较丰富，整体是一个收集类游戏，跟随着主线可以一直收集到不同的精灵，好感度，道具等等各种，后面还有街机游戏。
不是那种强战斗类型，给人很放松的感觉

不足的地方，一个是工具栏和背包的切换太麻烦，一个是指引不够清晰（和翻译也有一定关系）

整体还是很喜欢的!(不过街机游戏一下把难度拔高了）

author: {'steamid': '76561199467298790', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2704, 'last_played': 1709437847}
review: 一个玩法多样的游戏，能养小精灵，种田，清理杂草，去别的小镇探索，钓鱼，买家具，布置房子，做饮品，做菜，猜得种类很多，做完可以去卖掉赚钱。有一个小镇需要和npc比赛小游戏得分才能完成任务，小游戏有几个，都很不错，打完还有礼券换东西。衣服种类多样，万圣节还给了几套衣服。最后完成任务能上网了，能在网上买到好多衣服家具食品。这个游戏也有很多小任务，让你收集到停不下来，有一次我一天玩了11小时，很喜欢小精灵跳舞PK，哈哈哈

author: {'steamid': '76561198831440845', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1698368244}
review:
unfortunately I cannot recommend this game.  It is a fun quirky game but the amount of fetch quests ruined it for me. Along with that you have an insane amount of resource usage for these quests and with the price for seeds and how long it takes to grow some crops you never have enough cash. 

The one thing that really gets me is that this game does not have you water your crops first thing in the morning. It goes by whenever you last watered each individual crop. So let’s say you watered and planted some seeds at night and some in the day (because after selling somethings you were able to get more seeds), well at night is when the soil will dry out again for those crops that you watered at night, then during the day the other set of crops will dry out. Now imagine you have planted a variety of plants all through out the day. This creates chaos. Especially when you have used your stamina away from the farm because everything looked watered before you left, but when you return every other plant pops up dry and you have zero stamina to water them.

some people may not care but it just got boring after a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133168618', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2782, 'last_played': 1698019256}
review: This has been a great game for when its bedtime and I'm waiting for the benadryl to hit. It's a nice chill game that doesn't require too much thought on my part. If you like farming sims, creature collectors, dance battles, and card games, you might like this one. Plays nice on the Steam Deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067114446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1698305851}
review:
Absolutely a cute game. certainly gives off vibes of Animal Crossing, Pokemon, and Stardew, all in one game.

The music also reminds me of Here Comes Niko's OST. which is also a very cutesy game in nature. 

I have also heard this game is "Time consuming and Grind-y", but it really isn't. it's actually rather peaceful and slow. and it lets you grasp what's going on. the dialog also lets you take your time to read it as well.

Another thing I'd like to add is that; the characters also tend to say some witty things, that feel a bit AI generated, but really aren't. and are surprisingly funny, I have gotten a chuckle out of some of the dialog while playing myself actually!

Overall, I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199084469484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1700374365}
review: I adore this game. It's like harvest moon meets pokemon, but it takes the strengths of both and builds on it. I'm addicted. It has a good level of difficulty that keeps the gameplay interesting. Also some of the dialogue made me legit laugh out loud.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035641805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 190, 'playtime_at_review': 1134, 'last_played': 1711767193}
review:
I adore Ooblets. I've had it on Switch since launch and I jumped at the chance to get it on Steam. It's so close to being a perfect game. If you like farming sims or monster-collecting game I would put Ooblets at the top of your list. It does start a tiny bit slow, give it a couple hours if you're unsure of whether to keep playing. Otherwise the pacing feels so good. This is one of those titles that I keep coming back to. 

I would love to see more complex card game mechanics and the choice to make the AI more challenging. I also LOVE the dialogue, it's so funny, but would like to see more of it, especially with the filler NPCs.

author: {'steamid': '76561199121287220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1700644235}
review: Very cute game with better mechanics and fleshed out features than a lot of quick produced cozy games... however it's super buggy and the last two areas are... a mess. Stuck in Tippy top because you can't pick up an item required for the last quest before you reach the last tower...ouch. Doesn't help that it's an annoying 3 minute trek up a mountain each time to see if the bug fixed. Skates seem like a wonderful thing to discover until you realize the headaches both the movement and camera give you. The camera is great for overworld of the base town but it is so sloppy it's borderline unplayable in the Pantsabear hill. If you want a cute creature collector with unique game mechanics and a fun farm  piloted by little dudes it's worth it (just don't level up your coop past 2 or you'll never see your crops! lol) but beware that the endgame quests are less than fun fetch types and you may not even be working towards anything since the last quest is locked out. It seems a lot of the higher end stuff is just not polished, save your wishies as well as it's difficult to accumulate enough for the bigger farm when you stop getting those big payouts from badges. Overall I don't regret my purchase but it definitely doesn't feel like a game that planned it's world outside of town well and would have benefited from fleshing out any one of it's individual parts rather than take a plethora of things half-way alright-ish. Excited when they expand things, but definitely wait!
developer_response:
I'm sorry you didn't enjoy the game - thanks for the feedback!

If you're open to it, I'd love to grab a copy of your save data so I could take a look at that Tippy-Top bug. I haven't seen that one before.

Save data should be in 'C:\Users\[username]\AppData\LocalLow\Glumberland\Ooblets - Steam'. If you zip up that folder and email it to hello@ooblets.com, we'd really appreciate it)

No worries if you don't wanna deal with the hassle, though. :)

Thanks!

-Rebecca

author: {'steamid': '76561198140856835', 'num_games_owned': 2025, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 1092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1092, 'last_played': 1697930292}
review:
[Pay$-to-Play] I really had a lot of fun playing this game ^_^

Usually, I prefer to play games that direct us what to do instead of us figuring the game's mechanics on our own 
However, I am really really glad I've decided to take a leap of faith and give this game a go~

It may take a little while for us to fully grasp what's going on and what to do, but I think that lies the beauty of this game

[h1] What can we get out of Ooblets~ [/h1]
Sooo ooblets are those cute little creatures that we can tame if we win them in a dance battle~  and the dance battle is like card battler, its so so adorable when they dance and the music is eargasm, hahaha xD After winning, we can plant them like a crop XD (you'll see~)

There's also uncommon and shiny variant of it, I am very happy that I managed to find at least one of em, haha!

I relied on the ooblets wiki to figure out how to get the item to start a dance battle with an ooblet and stuff :P

Some helpful beginner tips:

[*] To get planklets, we can break logs / twigs

[*] To get nurnies, we can break rocks, we can get Oobsidian by breaking rocks too!

[*] To get some plant seeds starting out, we can clear weed and we can get seeds at times~

[*] Check your mailbox! I didnt initially and there was quite a few things I've only learnt when I checked them, hahaha

[*] There's daily tasks for us to do, if we can complete them, we can get wishies~

[*] Explore around the town, collect stuff as you go, like those fungus you see, they are needed for task progression~ Also you can enter houses! we can get useful items in there at times!

[*] Unlock the friendship sticker as soon as you can, and talk to townsfolks daily and we can get items at times~

[*] [Halloween event only] We can get candy from towfolks when we talk to them, so we can use them on the Reconstitooter which gives us slurry which gives us bait. The items we can fish out from fishing can help in our crops :D I upgraded the Reconstitooter and use higher quality bait~

There's more to uncover, I hope you will enjoy this game like I did!

Tags: [Adorable] [Creature Collection] [Farming] [Card Dance battler] [Fetch Quest] [My Favourite]

review: 游戏好玩 希望改进更多自动化比如做饮品 可以像做玉谷粉一样 选择多少个自动做 不然挺费时间的 很多菜谱也不知道怎么获得已经卡关了

author: {'steamid': '76561198144971739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2367, 'last_played': 1698337493}
review:
The ooblets are SO cute. You can pet them all, they follow you around and they can help you in your farm. The way this world acknowledges and treats these creatures is real cute too. It's chill and a very easy game, the stakes are never too high. Don't go in expecting anything profound.

The dialogue could do better— I feel like every character in this game is all whimsical and ironic, but maybe too ironic? The way this game is chill and feel-good, the cast is awfully self-aware in a way that didn't land much to me. It may be funny at first, oh look how self aware this game is, but in the end it makes it harder for immersion.

I personally do like that there isn't a romance mechanic! I like that there are shiny ooblets and they SHINE for real!

I'm sad that the ooblets don't evolve :( That'd be so cool

Having completed the main quest I'd say: don't expect the perfect mix of all the games this one takes inspiration from. Those are big shoes to fill, and there's definitely room for improvement. But it's at least like 40 hours of gameplay that I'm very satisfied with, and will probably keep playing for a while (it's a good depression game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198347418108', 'num_games_owned': 249, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1228, 'last_played': 1706528637}
review:
[h1] 和可爱的欧布精灵一起锄大地！ [/h1]

非常非常可爱的休闲小游戏，在锄地的同时帮助镇民建设没落的小镇，揭开隐藏在小镇背后的秘密，和更多的精灵邂逅吧！！

个人感觉本质是一款收集游戏，游戏的画风和音乐还有特效都很对我的胃口，闪光精灵的配色也非常漂亮。官方汉化很有梗，有些对话真的很好笑。游玩本作你可以获得：你可以拉着一长串可爱的小精灵跟着你当该溜子[spoiler] （闪光精灵的华丽拖尾特效，助您成为本条该最亮眼的溜子)[/spoiler]
、可以装修自己的家和开自己的小店并且狂爆镇民金币[spoiler] （我是懒狗我根本没开过店门，货架都是空的）[/spoiler]
、过上锄地睡觉锄地睡觉锄地睡觉循环的梦中的田园生活[spoiler] （你这体力怎么又见底了！不就扣了两块石头吗！）[/spoiler] 、和小精灵们打牌斗舞来捕捉不同种类的可爱小精灵，闪光精灵出率也很高哦！[spoiler]（全都塞进精灵小屋给我去种地）[/spoiler] 等等体验，卡库一得咻？来！试试看！


[h3]下面是一些小问题：[/h3]
不过首先说一下关于之前的口口字问题，我的话只在刚到镇子的那几天见过，目前已经到了山顶地图，没有再见过口口字，也可能是因为官方修复了吧，担心汉化乱码问题的朋友们可以入，目前并没有影响阅读的乱码问题啦。
游戏内容有点点少，感觉不是很够，主线任务给我一种被推着走的感觉，完成一个马上继续下一个，一连串的任务，都能预见自己接下来要干啥了。而且支线任务很少，类型还很重复，就是找精灵或者提交材料。我也想做更多更有趣的支线任务呀！
缺钱，很缺钱，还缺材料，啥都缺的我决定不开店，所以也不太确定开店是不是很赚钱。缺的钱理论上可以从订单补，但是我同时又很缺材料，这也没那也没导致我满街要饭变卖家产（夸张说法）。缺钱还手残的我到了港前小镇那叫一个血压upup，又不想打明显是为了拖时间的电子游戏，又没钱靠买工程师的作弊服务拿第一，最后没办法了靠抽万圣节奖池抽出来的果子卖钱才终于开了港口的塔。还是遂了制作组的愿坑了我一些时间，这点是我比较不喜欢的。个人感觉主线的跑腿部分应该做到有趣和拖时间并存，但是这个游戏的跑腿部分在有趣上面还是差了一点点。但是没关系看在人物可爱音效可爱的份上，我还是可以原谅的！[spoiler]（我愿意众筹帮那个街机小子上学，能不能盖个学校我要看他去里面愁眉苦脸）[/spoiler] 

总的来说，瑕不掩瑜的一款休闲游戏，建议不要像我一样玩的太急，慢慢来也能体会到更多乐趣，还是可以买入的！

author: {'steamid': '76561198196891851', 'num_games_owned': 465, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3857, 'last_played': 1698780201}
review:
种地收集宝可梦！雨点点在谷仓和下雨天可以收集。野地早点开，3级野地捡辣椒，5级钓鱼，10级挖矿体力换弹簧。谷仓跳舞可以赢得材料，小屋，菜谱，许愿币，建议每天都去。
港前小镇也有种子店！和家具店！菜谱要350的街机卷换。瘪气球也在港前小镇钓鱼获取，数量为1/2/3每次根据你的鱼饵稀有度。
俱乐部代币换的闪卡为一次性消耗品，
裤熊岭碎片有一个在塔的身后绕过去捡，去裤熊岭之前的遗物在镇长办公室的桌子上！！！
春季限定兔子可以调电脑时间4月15-30号来过春日节获取。
自己的商店可以在活动日卖活动物品议价来升级，优秀可以加经验，先开活动日。
木材和弹簧可以还原糖果，用三级鱼饵在欧布小镇获取还会出欧曜石。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090887763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1697642023}
review:
I really, really wanted to like this game. I really did. I like farming games like Harvest Moon and Stardew Valley and i also really like creature collector games, so the concept of combining them was interesting and appealed to me in a fundamental level. But there are just too many things that kinda stopped me from enjoying it.

First let me start with the things i DID like. As i mentioned, i like the concept of combining the farming game with the creature collector and i think that, if done correctly, this would be an amazing concept. I liked the little community we have at Badgetown and all the little quirky things about the game. It has a charm about it that you just don't see in many games.

The concept of the dance battle was an interesting twist to the creature collector battle mechanic that throws away the somewhat troublesome idea of making animals fight each other, though i do have my problems with how it's done here that i'll talk about in a bit.

I also liked exploring the different locales and the excitement of what kinds of ooblets i could find there and what seeds they have. Nullwood in particular was really cool. I like the shear number of things there is to do as well, it was hard to run out of things to do.

Now for the things i didn't really care for or thought could have been better implemented.
First off, i mentioned the idea of the dance battle was cool, the problem though was how it was done. It felt really lackluster. There are no explanations on what anything actually does until you try it and find out. Hype for example has zero in game explanation, i just had to do it and see what it did and then hope that it was good. It was, but i prefer to be able to plan out my battles in turn based systems like this. You could say that after you figure it out then that's not an issue, and you'd be right, but the lack of clarity initially was a bit of a turnoff for me.

Additionally, the card deck. OH the card deck. NO WAY of modifying it? REALLY? Considering how much your strategy relies on pulling the right card at the right time, not being able to modify your deck was irksome at best and devastating at worst. The basic deck has so many cards and your ooblets have so few special moves to add to it that it almost didn't matter what ooblets you used and trying to make synergies between them was a nightmare because you couldn't pick when you would get that signature move you want over something useless to you in that moment. You also lose all your beats and cards you have in your hand if you don't use them all up. You should be able to save them and use them in subsequent turns. Doing so would add A LOT more strategy to the battles.

Another thing that got on my nerves, you find an ooblet you want to battle so that you can add it to your collection. It WANTS to battle you. But you can't just battle it, no. You have to give it some kind of VERY SPECIFIC thing as an offering first. Now you could argue that it makes you diversify and have to farm and make things you otherwise wouldn't in order to get that ooblet. That's a fair point and i would concede that isn't a bad thing. However, the fact that they want things that you have to get recipes for that you can't just get the recipe for and have to rely on RNG to get is stupid and very contrived and demoralizing. I found a cat ghost looking thing that i wanted VERY BADLY in Nullwood. But required a specific dish i had to cook to let me battle it. Ok, how do i get that recipe? I can only earn it as a reward from the dance barn, which i can only participate in once a day to get things. And the recipe was apparently super rare to pop up in there and i never saw it even come up once. Even if i could get it to come up in the dance barn, the dance barn was painfully RNG based on if you can win or not. Due to the nature of the nonadjustable deck and other factors involving the dance barn, i would often find myself losing in the dance barn due to completely unavoidable RNG bullcrap that i had no way of avoiding. Welp, i guess i can't get that one probably ever.

I mentioned that there was plenty of things to do, and this is true and great. However, all the things you do are incredibly shallow and skin deep. It's like playing in a very large kiddie pool that the water only goes up to your ankles. Lots of places to go and things to do but nothing deep or satisfying and it just feels like that trying to advance on anything is artificially locked behind a contrived in game paywall, like the things you have to offer for dance battles for example. Almost all of the main story quests revolve around glorified fetch quests. There was one part of the game where in order to progress, i had to bring some entitled idiot 10 freaking cups of expensive coffee. Could i have technically farmed the stuff i needed to make it myself? Conceivably, but at the time i had no way of getting the springbeans needed, i didn't have a recipe to grind them, and i didn't have the recipe to brew the coffee either, so i had to go and buy them all which was extremely expensive for me at that stage of the game and i could only buy 3 a day, which means it took me 4 in game days to do this idiotic quest.

The thing that killed the game for me entirely though was when i got to Port Forward. It was explained that in order to progress i had to beat some uppity moron's high scores on every single one of the arcade games in town. Minigames are cool and fun as an option, but not when they are mandatory. Forcing you to have to do ALL of them was so dumb that i just couldn't take it anymore. They are all super shallow reflex based games too, which i find incredibly annoying and do not enjoy playing in the slightest. So locking my progress behind gameplay that i find to be just irritating and infuriating at best is just going to make me quit playing the game.

If i had any input on how to improve this game, there are only a few things that would have to change.

1. Make the deck modifiable. This is the most important thing. Add in a card shop that you can buy different cards to change out your deck with and give the ooblets more special signature moves they can do that you can ALSO toggle on and off when you use them with your deck. Even without adding new card mechanics, this would be a huge upgrade, though more interesting card mechanics would be welcome as well.

2. Lower the requirements to be able to battle ooblets. I'm not saying that you should be able to battle them for free because the idea behind the concept is not lost on me. But maybe you have to make an offering that meets a certain amount of points and different things you can offer will give different amounts of points based on that ooblet's preferences. Like if you make it the certain dish that it likes then it'll fill up the offering points you need a great amount.

3. Have more things you can do to open up places besides fetch more planklets and nurneys! Maybe you have to have a certain ooblet to help build the place, or perhaps there is a group of ooblets in the place you have to battle out like at the very beginning of the game with Mayor Tinsel's office.

4. For the love of all you hold sacred, don't force me to have to beat the high score on all these stupid, shallow reflex based arcade games that are just knockoffs of mindless, idiotic mobile games! It's explained in the story that in order to have claim on the tower, that you have to have the high score on ALL of them. If you beat his high score on 1-2 of the games, wouldn't that void HIS claim on it? Or how about this, you have the option to do a side quest with the mayor of that town to have them declare that tower as public domain that no one person can have claim to and kick his stupid butt out of the tower? Add an additional reward for people who WANT to beat all the high scores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006658407', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2476, 'last_played': 1698636825}
review:
An excellent experience of videogaming. Ooblets scratches a lot of itches at once. It's a little bit monster collector, a little bit farming sim, a little bit town life, but it's not too deep in any area. Although there are some ways the game could be fleshed out in perhaps a sequel or big content expansion (I'll get into a few ideas about this later), overall I think the balance is actually just right for me.

I have a lot of games that ask a lot of me and I also have some games which are relaxing but in some ways ask *too little* of me. It's tough to find a game that hits a sweet spot between too much and too little sometimes. Ooblets is, for me, in an ideal point where there's just enough to engage with to keep me motivated but not so much that I ever feel overwhelmed or like I just need to slog through a bunch of grinding etc.

The style and theme are unique and quirky in a way I overall liked. I'm not saying every joke lands or anything but such is the nature of comedy. Overall I liked the light-hearted interactions with townsfolk as a contrast from too many games which try to do Grand Storytelling when sometimes I just wanna buy a new jacket and didn't actually need to get a whole lore dump about how the shopkeeper was sad a lot as a kid.

At just over 40 hours I've completed the main storyline and I'm now I'm mostly winding down and collecting gleamy ooblets, perfecting my farm, etc. I'm not sure if I'll get a ton more out of the game but I wouldn't be surprised if I play for at least 10 more hours and that's a pretty good value overall.

There are a few areas I'd like to see fleshed out. Vacation spots are a little underwhelming. Having the Dance Barn as my only reliable source for battles with other trainers at the end of the game is a little disappointing it would be cool to maybe have Dance Barn type locations in other places like Nullwhere and Port Forward that maybe hold events less often but would give you another excuse to travel. Lastly, without major spoilers, the endgame feels like it could use some kind of epilogue focused on tearing out some unnecessary facilities and doing restoration perhaps.

None of these criticisms are major detractors though and the game still stands up as a fantastic experience. My best hope is for an Ooblets 2 where I can dance battle my friends as so many of my buddies are playing this game and we all talk team composition/strategy and how we we wish we could battle each other!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035962712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3467, 'last_played': 1704508221}

author: {'steamid': '76561198168426583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1598, 'last_played': 1697494123}
review: J'ai adorais le jeu dans l'ensemble même si  il possede quelque defaut ! Deja j'aurais tellement voulus me faire une jolie petite ferme mais le jeu en terme de personnalisation c'est absent, même pour la personnalisation du perso c'est pas ouf on a qu'un type de corps on change rien sur le visage. L'achat de l'agrandissement de la maison est si chere je l'ai upgrade seulement a la fin du jeu tellement je preferais claquer mes Bonbecs ailleurs :').. Sinon j'ai tellement aimé le fait que ce soit des battle de danse et non pas des combats a la Pokémon avec les musiques et les combinaisons entre nos ooblets Avec leurs competences c'etait tres fun ! Ah et dernier petit probleme a mon gout c'est que les ooblets sont tous fait pareil avec deux pieds et deux bras (ou pas) qui sont bien present mais pas attaché au corps donc les danses ne sont pas adapté a tout les ooblets (demembrement selon certaines danse) ou les bras qui rentre dans la bidoche mais bon rien de bien mechant juste de l'esthetique. Bref je recommande car le jeu est tres fun et tres cute les couleurs sont vif le style est rafraichissant je re-co-mmaaaande !

author: {'steamid': '76561198018399456', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 926, 'last_played': 1698090773}
review:
[h1]Controversial game about growing cute lil bois[/h1]

The developers of this game had the audacity to call a specific subset of potential consumers (mythical beings known as "Gamers" (pronounced: [b]gay[/b] · muh, Latin: [i]venatus[/i] )) juvenile and lacking of proper manners, to which this group of people responded by engaging in coordinated poorly mannered behaviour in the most juvenile fashion possible. While this was all very well and puerile, it completely misrepresented the tone of the game for me so you can imagine the truck-heckload of disappointment I was in for.

As it turns out though, this game isn't so much about dealing with the fragile egos of a mass of entitled babbylords - I'm sad to say that instead, this is a wholesome game about having your own fragile ego repaired by caring for cute lil babby bois and doing some dank dances together, often inside a barn. It's all very enjoyable, relaxing stuff and the entire package is put together with so much love and character it's just outright disgusting. I can't believe those dang game developers got me again. Bamboozled.

In conclusion:

[h2] 2/10 I was lied to and heartily recommend this to literally anyone[/h2]

author: {'steamid': '76561198297384332', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1697864786}
review:
I've put in a few hours and can say that I genuinely love the game! It has its own appeal to farm sim and creature collector fans, and I can see that it takes inspiration from a few other games. I was not aware of any community drama until after I got it so I don't care to comment on it tbh.

The progress is much slower than Stardew Valley. In fact, it's just slow in general. The main campaign tasks are tied to your level, so you can actually complete them at a lower level and then only have side quest options. However, I never felt like I had nothing to do since I would spend my downtime foraging, micro-managing my farm, fishing, crafting, cooking, and decorating/accessorizing. Hot take, but I feel like Ooblets does the farming part better than SV. It's easier to gain momentum when harvesting/planting, and the crops are actually useful for completing the main campaign. They are also much easier to profit from, as you can process them into food with ease or you can use the Plenny export shack to earn massive profits for set amounts of crops. 

The creature part is very unique! The dance battles are executed via deck battles like Slay the Spire. When you win, you get an Ooblet seed which then can grow into a new friend! Your Ooblets follow you around like in Heartgold/Soulsilver, but you can also leave a few at the farm to help you take care of your crops. One of the cons is that the game doesn't let you talk with your following Ooblets or let you feed them treats, which I would've liked to see. There is an incentive to collect many different types to allow for synergy with your chosen dance troupe; some Ooblet dance moves work best with others. The game does allow for adventuring to other areas to collect new crops and Ooblets. The game also lets you put accessories on all your Ooblets! :D

All in all, I really do recommend it if you're interested!

author: {'steamid': '76561199036937300', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1697131863}
review:
星露谷物语的痕迹太重，本来想着当3D版星露谷玩也不错。但设定又太过中二，不如星露谷物语自然，很难带入，玩的时候感觉有种尴尬到不适的感觉，原地扣出三室一厅。所以打算去玩星露谷。

不过总之是个人口味的问题，游戏玩法是很不错的，只要能接受这个设定还是个好游戏。

author: {'steamid': '76561199003438529', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1948, 'last_played': 1699206891}
review:
好玩，一连肝了好几天，总算把万圣节的东西都肝齐了，抽奖确实非酋之泪，每个锅最后几个的时候就抽奖前存档抽了没有新的直接关了游戏再开读存档……
万圣节的糖果肝完还剩下快俩百多颗，发现自己开店卖一颗八十，点了售价提升的，直接一百多一颗，一个白天赚一千，致富之路了。
目前的东西就可以玩很久，也发现还有很多没做完的，期待后面的载具，感觉可以一直玩下去，买了不少大作，结果还是这种可可爱爱的游戏适合我，慢慢玩了，等更新。

author: {'steamid': '76561198346249321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2405, 'last_played': 1709380112}
review:
玩法轻松简单、音乐也很动感令人愉悦~ 人物、精灵、家具的装饰搭配种类多样、自由度很高~  
种地——完成订单——收货大量QQ糖，再购买摆放心仪已久的家具那一刻，多巴胺释放到位了。很适合收集喜好的玩家。
不足：后期的场景探索内容少，人物交互的单一（可以理解毕竟体量不到1G）。
精灵经验等级不知有没有上限，技能齐全后再升级没有意义（基本是先普通精灵满6级后又不想带、等刷到闪光精灵想带出来拉风还要重刷等级、普通精灵只能卸队归田）、牌组技能也可以再优化。
钓鱼功能只是废物再利用处，没有真正意义的钓鱼。
总之很推荐打折时入手，休闲时小肝放松一下还是不错的~ 期待制作组们的后续更新~

author: {'steamid': '76561198207309475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2236, 'last_played': 1697513503}
review:
37小时主线全通，成就全达成。闪光稳定产出。
提一些更方便玩家的建议：
1.箱子增加一键添加现有物品。现在是要么全拿出来要么全放进去，当我箱子没满的时候，要一个个手动从背包才能添加进去。
2.每日的精灵只有起床时候显示那一次，内容很多很容易忘，最好做成可以随时查看的。
3.添加memo功能，有时候一天要做很多事情，忙了一件忘了下一件，然后白白多跑路。
4.精灵操作界面的逻辑要再优化和统一，从随从可以右键直接放回家里，但是反之不行，然后在家里的精灵不知道具体在哪个小屋，有时候需要做野地任务从小屋拿出来，就不知道要放回哪个小屋。
5.主线通关后，有些小东西应该能在商店购买的到，要钓鱼一个个钓概率很低，很麻烦。为了时长的话，做任务换也行。
6.卖货要手动一个个上货，很不方便，建议添加库存。或者添加托管给精灵，让精灵帮忙上货或售卖。


出闪光的方法：
除了系统概率之外。可以在解锁一个俱乐部后，在里面买卡牌，有招闪光的技能。

author: {'steamid': '76561198027508578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 3568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3161, 'last_played': 1697678402}
review:
A cutesy, whacky and excessively wholesome Farming-Sim marketed for kids about Slavery.
It doesn't have any right to be this good.

Battling sentient little plant-things, taking their firstborn seed as prize and making them work on your plantation, so you can sell the produce for profit. Or refine it into goods for even more profit. Or sell it to the other slave owners for maximum profit in your very own shop.
It's lighthearted, silly and deeply disturbing in all the right ways. I absolutely love this game.
I even live-streamed it here:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZSGN5-21eeY
You can watch the VOD if you rather want to listen to me rambling on instead of typing this nonsense here.
Now get lost, my Oooblets have beans to grind, squash to turn into slush, crops to farm and quotas to meet.

author: {'steamid': '76561199086328868', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 23, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1711917146}
review: No opinion on the whole feud. Just my opinion about the game only. You can tell devs worked hard on this game. There's a lot to do that, as a busybody, i love! You can also play at ur own pace to relax. At 10hrs in, there is still a lot to do and it seems the world ig is huge! SPOILERS AHEAD Lots of customization tho i wished there were more skin colors (lighter skin tones esp.) I really hope they come out with dlcs or expand the game so vets in the future don't run out of content. There's currently a halloween event for the next month and its super cool with all the disguises and store decorations around town. There's a whole lot of dancing with turn-based card play. You can dress up ur little oob pets and the rare ones are unique and sparkly. You get fun things from townspeople after friendship levels. It's simply adorable. I think this game can be enjoyable for those who like cozy gameplay, achievements, lots of customization/decor, adorable dancing, exploration, farming, and detailed friendship building, and perhaps a bit of strategy. I will see if i can update after more significant game completion. Thank you for your efforts, devs! A relaxing and destressful way to get my mind off what's going on in the real world. Keep it up :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198076405706', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1699630590}
review:
Капец, нам её куратор показал,когда мы были желторотыми перваками. Там уже и Дыбовский Мор выпустил, и мы бакалавриат геймдизайна получили, а оно все было в разработке... 

И вот, этот день настал! Ровно в тот время, как мне нужен не очень напряжный, расслабляющий геймплей, чисто поиграть после работы или втихушку на ней.

Своим друзьям я описала эту игру в пару строк: возьмите покемонов, прикрутите им вместо махача денс-батл и пустите их в стардью валли, но добавьте туда третье измерение. Получите Ooblets. Так же готова описывать это и тут: носишься, ловишь все, что движется, выращиваешь чувачков в грядке... Кайф.


Расслабляющая, ну прямо таки сахарно-няшная, добрая игрушка, в которой лично мне на данном этапе весело и интересно бегать по дурацким поручениям, просто потому, что это дает не только какие-то очки репутации у своих, но и двигает куда-то там сюжет (а куда: узнаю в следующей серии, как обычно)

Брала без скидки, потому что лелею мечту поддержать разрабов вот уже 5 лет, и пока что не пожалела, что отдала все копейки, что она стоит.
